file_content.text: Our forces in the maximum-security block are finally getting their supplies. We'll lock down this prison in no time.
I'll bet your group struck some fear into those prisoners. Good--they'll be easier to contain.
I doubt the prisoners were expecting a Jedi's personal attention.
The prisoners got a taste of their own medicine, courtesy of the Republic's finest.
If there's any justice, those prisoners are soiling themselves and cowering in the jungle.
I'll send a fresh resupply team to our forces in the field. We'll have it easier locking things down, thanks to you.
Once we secure the area, we'll round up that scum and put everyone away for good.
The only way to reopen our supply lines is by scattering those Rattataki mercenaries and eliminating their leaders. Hurry!
Finally--reinforcements! Blasted good ones, from the look of you.
A Jedi--perfect! You're the solution I've been looking for.
Major, am I glad to see you! Got a situation right up your alley.
You're not Imperial or a prisoner, and you're still alive. Good enough for me! I need your help.
You're officially outside prison grounds--this part of the jungle was designated for future construction, but it's just outposts and old vaults for now.
Problem is, the lack of security means escapees are pouring in from the main wing. They ambush and slaughter my reinforcements, then vanish like ghosts into the vegetation.
These aren't common criminals. Who are they? How do they attack your people and get away so easily?
Tell me about the prisoners.
It's more Rattataki, but these aren't Blood of Talath. This is a group of mercenary commandos who butchered whole settlements on Obroa-skai.
We captured them alive, dumped them here and threw away the key. Unfortunately, the Empire set them loose.
The Rattataki have survival training and no love for the Republic. Even worse, they looted our supplies. They could hold out indefinitely.
I won't let them.
If we can recover the equipment they stole, it might force them to surrender.
What if we take the supplies?
It's too late for that. The prisoners are spread out. They don't have a main camp for us to raid.
You have nothing but bad news.
There is one shred of good news in all this.
Sounds like a job for me.
Recruit better soldiers.
These are no ordinary prisoners. It's the Rattataki again--this bunch murdered entire settlements on Obroa-skai before we captured them.
Intelligence reports indicate the prisoners are led by a few experienced men. Eliminate those leaders, and the others won't have tactical guidance.
I can provide the prisoners' last known location. I need you to go in, disperse them and remove their leaders.
Consider it done.
With your help, we'll lock down Belsavis twice as hard.
Are you prepared to pay me?
Can't believe you, of all people, would demand payment... I'll think of something--just stop the attacks on my men.
I lead the Ninety-fourth Supply Division. If I don't have what you want, I'll get it. Just deal with that scum.
The prisoners are hiding in the jungle at these coordinates. They'll have the advantage of terrain and surprise. Be careful.
Sorry, I can't. [Refuse quest]
Blast it... at least spread the word we need help here. Maybe someone else can lend a hand.
Sorry, no time. Keeping the supply lines open takes everything I've got.
